subject: Add lifetime property for drives interface
commitMessage:
Add lifetime property for drives interface

This will set the lifetime property when the eStoraged object is
created. This change does not expect the lifetime to change.

Tested:
busctl introspect  xyz.openbmc_project.eStoraged.mmcblk0 /xyz/openbmc_project/inventory/storage/mmcblk0
NAME                                      TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable       interface -         -            -
.Introspect                               method    -         s            -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer                 interface -         -            -
.GetMachineId                             method    -         s            -
.Ping                                     method    -         -            -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties           interface -         -            -
.Get                                      method    ss        v            -
.GetAll                                   method    s         a{sv}        -
.Set                                      method    ssv       -            -
.PropertiesChanged                        signal    sa{sv}as  -            -
xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Drive  interface -         -            -
.Capacity                                 property  t         (top secret) emits-change
.PredictedMediaLifeLeftPercent            property  y         100          emits-change
xyz.openbmc_project.Inventory.Item.Volume interface -         -            -
.ChangePassword                           method    ayay      -            -
.Erase                                    method    s         -            -
.FormatLuks                               method    ays       -            -
.Lock                                     method    -         -            -
.Unlock                                   method    ay        -            -

Signed-off-by: John Edward Broadbent <jebr@google.com>
Change-Id: Ifbbed7d81c55e3edbe519c2b1048b5d1731fbb0e

Let me know if you see anything that needs attention.
Looks like this should be 'string'. You don't actually use string_view in this file.

Is this supposed to be continuation of the above sentence?
```
"The interface to kernel data structures"
```

If so, should it be something like:
```
"The interface to kernel data structures dealing with this disk"
```

And therefore, small d?
FYI, I plan to remove all these arguments once I integrate eStoraged with EntityManager. At that point, I want to implement code to look for the sysfs entries automatically.
Could we get a more descriptive variable names or a brief comment on what these 2 bytes from /life_time file is supposed to give us? or where in the spec this is taken from
yes, I added the information I have.
It might be worth also checking if either value is too big, in case you read a bogus value.
Do we need to think about underflow cases here?
Yeah, it's actually possible to read back 11.

yes, the values should range from 1 to 11, and I changed the logic, to maximize granularity, at the expense of being pessimistic. 
 
Let me know what you think.
I think this makes sense to me, would like to hear from John Wedig as well
Maybe end the previous line with a period or continue this as a single sentence with "that" Linux...
Looks like John Wedig has some suggestions
This is capitalized in the yaml file: https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/blob/master/yaml/xyz/openbmc_project/Inventory/Item/Drive.interface.yaml
